div.span: Wellston City Schools Provides a Variety of Methods for Notifications:

li.span: Sends a Phone Call to the Primary Household Contact Provided in the Student System
Follow Wellston City Schools on Facebook.

br.span: MAKE SURE YOUR CONTACT INFORMATION IS CURRENT IN OUR SYSTEM SO THAT YOU DON’T MISS OUT ON IMPORTANT NOTIFICATIONS!

td.br: We request that you please visit our school website, where you will find explicit instructions to continue our distance learning program during the COVID 19 shut down; in an effort to create a more manageable and practical plan, our plans have been revised and refined based on need. We appreciate your flexibility and patience, as we are all learning real time during these unprecedented events.
If anyone has any health related concerns or questions and would like to reach out to our District Nurse during this time, please do so by emailing Kelly Waugh, RN at the following address...
Is your child's teacher using Google Classroom? Here's a helpful guide for parents.

Many, if not all, of your teachers are using Google Hangout. Please check your google account to make sure you have access; if you are using your phone, you will need to download the Google Hangout app. Call the school if you have questions.

div.p:
The purpose of the "Phase I WCS
Community Track" committee is to
provide an athletic facility in which
to promote healthful, meaningful
sports and recreational programs
for all ages.

Wellston City Schools will achieve excellence in education for ALL learners.
The purpose of WCS is to: educate ALL students using differentiated instruction, develop the whole child, provide
a caring, safe & respectful environment, develop successful members of society.

a.b: STANLEY NAMED ADENA ATHLETE OF THE MONTH FOR APRIL

td.br: With the extension of the mandatory closure of school due to COVID-19, WCS has now suspended all athletic activities through at least May 1st per the OHSAA. All facilities are closed as well to all users and groups through at least May 1st. The facility list includes, but is not limited to, all gyms, the baseball field, the softball field, the hitting barn, the football field, the old track, and all weight rooms. Thank you for your continued cooperation. We hope May brings better news. Stay safe.

a.b: STANLEY, HENDERSHOTT FINALISTS FOR ADENA STUDENT-ATHLETE OF THE MONTH

td.br:
Voting Begins April 1st through April 7th on Adena's Facebook Page
Good Luck Timothy and Kylee!

All student-athletes must have a valid physical exam form on file with the athletic department prior to the first mandatory practice of the season. OHSAA has revised their official form for the 2020-21 school year so all athletes must have this form on file to be eligible to begin practice.
At this time all fall sports are allowed to begin mandatory practice on Saturday, August 1st.

Online Student-Athlete Participation Forms
These electronic forms are required for athletic participation at WMS and WHS (grades 7-12)

With the mandatory shutdown of school due to COVID-19, WCS has suspended all athletic activities through at least April 5th. All facilities are closed to all users and groups through at least April 5th as well. The facility list includes, but is not limited to, all gyms, the baseball field, the softball field, the hitting barn, the football field, the old track, and all weight rooms. Thank you for your cooperation and we hope to be back in action soon.

The Tri-Valley Conference will now kickoff Friday night varsity football games at 7 pm ET beginning with the 2020 season. The conference rule had been 7:30 pm kickoffs. To stay consistent, Wellston High School will also kickoff all non-conference games at C.H. Jones Field on Friday nights at 7 pm ET. If any change occurs to the time the gates open for paying spectators it will be announced at a later date. The gates currently open at 6 pm.
